fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives:
All recent EU policy developments and initiatives that are relevant for business. The participants do not discuss markets, projects or prices and all do respect their code of conduct. 
To this end the only activity of AMISA2 consists of a monthly debate of 90 minutes over breakfast with key officials and policy makers from the European Institutions and foreign embassies. Topics were: 
The EU Justice Agenda 
Single Market Status 
The EP Sustainability Agenda 
The EIB's Role in strengthening the EU 
The Energie-Wende: Europe and Germany 
EU Finances - Crisis Management 
Economics of EU Competition Policy 
The European Ombudsman - Transparency and Accountability 
The Eastern Dimension 
TTIP and CEFA 
Financial Policies - Status 
MOVE for Growth 
Transatlantic Relationships 
Framework for Competitiveness and Growth 
Turkey's geopolitical Situation - Consequences for Business 
European Agenda for Migration 
Digital Single Market 
The economics of EU competition policy 
The Ombudsman 
Climate and Energy in Harmony 
Data Protection 
BREXIT 
Collaborative Economy 
Competition Policy vs. Globalisation 
Trading with Europe 
The Juncker Commission and the Internal Market 
Digital Transport Markets 
EU Strategic Outlook 
Clean Energy Transition 
European Defence - NATO and EU 
EU Budget Control 
The Commission - Strategic Challenges 
MFF and Financial Instruments
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
AMISA2 does not belong to any other network or organisation and always operates stand-alone. 
Members are: 
1.         ABB 
2.        AIRBUS 
3.        ALLIANZ 
5.        BASF

relevant_communication: Since there are no identical interests among members, no common views no plans for statements, events or publications exist.
goals__remit:
The association intends to promote European political information, education and exchange. To this end 
AMISA2 holds monthly breakfast debates with key speakers from the EU-institutions in order to focus the attention of corporate representatives on recent developments in EU policy fields and to make them aware of planned policies.
